Description: Body sherd of East Greek, possibly Chian, pottery plate with low ring foot; creamy slip; glaze fired orange to orange-brown; interior, from outside, band; added red band; band of dots between pairs of dilute lines; in tondo, tongue pattern; exterior: glaze and red bands; outside of ring foot glazed, underside reserved.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.550.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2152) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
